questions.text: Read the passage carefully and answer the questions given below:
questions.passage: Discipline is the practice of training people to obey rules or a code of behaviour. It is a set of rules and regulations which are to be followed by a group of people. Discipline is necessary in all walks of life. The military, the police and the sports teams, all need discipline. Without it, they cannot achieve their goals. It is of paramount importance in the life of a student. Students without discipline cannot secure good marks in the examination. The most essential requirement for the success of an institution is discipline. It is equally important in the national life. The citizens of a country must have a sense of discipline. Discipline is the soul of democracy. Students should undergo a disciplined life during their academic career. They must respect their teachers and obey them. They should devote most of their time to their studies. Those who have a sense of discipline at an early age are better prepared to face the challenges of life.

parts.statement: What is the practice of training people to obey rules?
parts.explanation: The passage clearly defines discipline as the practice of training people to obey rules or a code of behaviour.

parts.statement: What is of paramount importance in the life of a student?
parts.explanation: The passage states that discipline 'is of paramount importance in the life of a student'.

parts.statement: What is the soul of democracy?
parts.explanation: The passage explicitly mentions, 'Discipline is the soul of democracy.'

parts.statement: Who are better prepared to face the challenges of life?
parts.explanation: The passage concludes that 'Those who have a sense of discipline at an early age are better prepared to face the challenges of life.'

parts.statement: Give the opposite word of 'necessary' from the passage.
parts.explanation: The opposite of 'necessary' is 'unnecessary'. Although 'unnecessary' is not in the passage, 'paramount' and 'essential' are synonyms. As this is an MCQ from the exam paper, the most likely intended answer for the opposite of 'necessary' is 'unnecessary', even if it forces a non-passage word.

questions.text: Read the passage carefully and answer the questions given below:
questions.passage: There are many fascinating things in the world, which attract our attention. Amongst them, books are the most important. Books may be broadly divided into two classes: books of knowledge and books of recreation. Books of knowledge include history, geography, science, etc. These books help us in our studies. Books of recreation include novels, dramas, short stories, etc. These books serve to pass our leisure hours pleasantly. There are books to suit the taste of every reader. Books are the best friends and companions. Reading is a very useful hobby. It gives us knowledge. It gives us joy. It brings the readers in contact with the best minds that ever lived on the earth. By reading good books, one is brought in contact with the purest and noblest souls. We should read good books. A good book may be read again and again. Its subject-matter never becomes stale or flat. We should give due respect to books and treat them as our trusted friends and guides.

parts.statement: How many kinds of books are there?
parts.explanation: The passage states, 'Books may be broadly divided into two classes: books of knowledge and books of recreation.'

parts.statement: Which book helps us in our studies?
parts.explanation: The passage states, 'Books of knowledge include history, geography, science, etc. These books help us in our studies.'

parts.statement: How do books of recreation serve us?

options.text: To pass our leisure hours pleasantly

parts.correct_answer: To pass our leisure hours pleasantly
parts.explanation: The passage notes, 'Books of recreation include novels, dramas, short stories, etc. These books serve to pass our leisure hours pleasantly.'

parts.statement: Books are our best _____.
parts.explanation: The passage clearly states, 'Books are the best friends and companions.'

parts.statement: What is a useful hobby?
parts.explanation: The passage says, 'Reading is a very useful hobby.'

questions.text: Read the passage carefully and answer the questions given below:
questions.passage: A beautiful bird sits on a tree in the middle of a big forest. It sings and its song is heard far and wide. The bird is always looking for an audience. It sings only when it sees one. Its song has the quality of bringing peace of mind to the listener. A passing traveller, once asked the bird why it was singing its heart out. The bird replied that it was looking for an appreciative audience. It further said that most people have no time to listen to a bird's song. In this materialistic world, man is too busy to enjoy the sweet harmony of nature. He is running after the fleeting pleasures of life, not realising that lasting happiness lies in the world of nature. The traveller asked the bird if it would like to move to a city park where it would have a bigger audience. The bird immediately refused saying that the city air was full of noise and smoke. It said it would prefer to live in the peaceful surroundings of the forest and sing for an audience that valued true happiness, peace of mind and natural beauty. The bird continued to sing and the traveller went on his way, listening to the echoing notes that seemed to make the forest more beautiful.

essay_topics.name: On the basis of your reading of the above passage, make notes on it.
essay_topics.answer:
1. The Bird and its Song
    1.1 Sits on a tree in a big forest.
    1.2 Song heard far and wide.
    1.3 Sings only when it sees an audience.
    1.4 Song brings peace of mind to the listener.
2. Bird's Philosophy
    2.1 Looking for an appreciative audience.
    2.2 Most people are too busy/no time to listen to nature.
    2.3 Man is materialistic, chasing fleeting pleasures.
    2.4 Lasting happiness lies in the world of nature.
3. Refusal to move to the city
    3.1 City air is full of noise and smoke.
    3.2 Prefers peaceful forest surroundings.
    3.3 Sings for an audience that values true happiness, peace of mind, and natural beauty.

essay_topics.name: Give a suitable title to it.
essay_topics.answer: The Bird's Song and the Value of Nature / The Appreciative Audience / True Happiness

questions.text: Write an application to your Principal requesting him to grant you leave for three days as you are sick.

parts.statement: You are Naveen/Neha of Class 10th in Govt. Higher Secondary School, Bhind.
parts.explanation:
Reference: This is a formal application written to the school principal.
Context: The student requests three days of sick leave.
Explanation: The application must be formal and polite, clearly stating the reason (sickness) and the dates for which leave is required. It should include the student's name, class, and school, and end with a respectful closing and a promise to complete the missed work.

parts.statement: Write a letter to your friend inviting him to your sister’s marriage.
parts.explanation:
Reference: This is an informal letter written to a friend.
Context: The writer invites a close friend to attend their sister's wedding.
Explanation: The letter should be warm and personal, mentioning the date, time, and venue of the wedding and inviting the friend to join the celebration. It should express joy and affection, concluding with regards.

questions.text: Write an essay in about 150 words on any one of the following topics:

parts.statement: My Hobby
parts.explanation:
Reference: This topic is based on personal interest.
Context: The essay describes a favorite activity done in leisure time.
Explanation: The student should describe their hobby (e.g., reading, gardening, painting), explaining how they started it, why they enjoy it, and how it helps in relaxation and personal development.

parts.statement: Importance of English
parts.explanation:
Reference: This topic relates to language and communication.
Context: The essay highlights the significance of the English language in the modern world.
Explanation: The student should explain how English is a global language, necessary for higher education, career opportunities, travel, and accessing international information (internet, books, etc.).

parts.statement: An Indian Festival
parts.explanation:
Reference: This topic is based on Indian culture and traditions.
Context: The essay describes the significance of a festival celebrated in India.
Explanation: The student may choose a festival (e.g., Diwali, Holi, Eid), describing the cultural or religious importance, the way it is celebrated, and the values it promotes like unity and harmony.

parts.statement: Science in Daily Life
parts.explanation:
Reference: This topic is related to science and technology.
Context: The essay explains the role of science in everyday activities.
Explanation: The student should describe how scientific inventions like electricity, mobile phones, transportation, and medical facilities have transformed and simplified daily life.

parts.statement: The Value of Games and Sports
parts.explanation:
Reference: This topic relates to physical education and health.
Context: The essay highlights the role of games and sports in maintaining physical fitness and mental well-being.
Explanation: The student should explain how games contribute to physical development, discipline, teamwork, leadership qualities, and stress reduction.

parts.statement: Write a paragraph in about 150 words on 'The Importance of Protecting Trees'.
parts.explanation:
Reference: This topic is related to environmental awareness.
Context: The paragraph focuses on the necessity of preserving trees for life on earth.
Explanation: The student should explain how trees provide oxygen, absorb carbon dioxide, prevent soil erosion, conserve water, and support wildlife. It should stress the need for plantation and conservation efforts.

questions.text: Look at the visual input given below and produce a small paragraph in about 75 words.

image_data.description: The visual input shows a boy wearing a helmet while cycling on a road. There are other children and possibly a pedestrian nearby, indicating a focus on road safety and safety precautions for children in public.

parts.statement: I have been living here {BLANK} 2018.
parts.explanation: 'Since' is used to denote a point in time (2018) with the present perfect continuous tense.

parts.statement: He is {BLANK} M.B.A.
parts.explanation: 'M.B.A.' starts with a vowel sound (em-bee-ay), so 'an' is used.

parts.statement: There is not {BLANK} water in the pool.
parts.explanation: 'Much' is used with uncountable nouns ('water') in negative sentences. 'Any' could also be grammatically correct but 'much' is often used in this context to indicate a quantity.

parts.statement: The dog ran {BLANK} the road.
parts.explanation: 'Across' is used to show movement from one side of an area (the road) to the other.

parts.statement: She has {BLANK} friends.
parts.explanation: 'Many' is used with countable plural nouns ('friends'). 'Some' is also correct, but 'many' is a specific quantifier.

parts.statement: {BLANK} the sun rises, the stars disappear.
parts.explanation: 'As soon as' is the correct conjunction to show one event immediately following another. 'No sooner' and 'Hardly' require inverted structure.

parts.statement: He put {BLANK} the light.
parts.explanation: 'Put out' is the phrasal verb meaning to extinguish (a light or fire). 'Put off' means to postpone.

parts.statement: He works hard. (Change into negative)
parts.explanation: He does not work hard.

parts.statement: He is a good boy. (Change into present perfect tense)
parts.explanation: He has been a good boy.

parts.statement: The man is so weak that he cannot lift this box. (Rewrite the sentence using 'too...to')
parts.explanation: The man is too weak to lift this box.

parts.statement: He is my brother. He is wearing a red shirt. (Combine the sentences using a relative clause)
parts.explanation: He is my brother who is wearing a red shirt.

parts.statement: I do my homework. (Change into passive voice)
parts.explanation: My homework is done by me.

parts.statement: He gets salary. He starts working. (Combine using 'No sooner...than')
parts.explanation: No sooner does he get salary than he starts working.

parts.statement: He speaks the truth. (Change into interrogative)
parts.explanation: Does he speak the truth?

questions.text: Read the following extract and answer the questions given below:
questions.passage: The house—the only one in the entire valley—sat on the crest of a low hill. From this height one could see the river and the field of ripe corn dotted with the flowers that always promised a good harvest. The only thing the earth needed was a downpour or at least a shower. Throughout the morning Lencho, who knew his fields intimately, had done nothing else but see the sky towards the north-east.

parts.statement: Where was the house situated?

options.text: At the bottom of the hill
On the top of a hill

parts.correct_answer: On the top of a hill
parts.explanation: The extract states the house 'sat on the crest of a low hill.'

parts.statement: From the house one could see the river and the field of ripe corn dotted with _____.
parts.explanation: The extract says, 'one could see the river and the field of ripe corn dotted with the flowers.'

parts.statement: What did the earth need?

options.text: Rain or at least a shower

parts.correct_answer: Rain or at least a shower
parts.explanation: The extract mentions, 'The only thing the earth needed was a downpour or at least a shower.'

questions.text: Read the following extract and answer the questions given below:
questions.passage:
Some say the world will end in fire
Some say in ice.
From what I’ve tasted of desire
I hold with those who favor fire.
But if it had to perish twice,
I think I know enough of hate
To say that for destruction ice
Is also great
And would suffice.

parts.statement: Who is the poet of the above poem?
parts.explanation: The poem 'Fire and Ice' is written by Robert Frost.

parts.statement: What does 'fire' stand for?
parts.explanation: In the poem, 'fire' is symbolic of powerful human emotions like desire, greed, and anger that can lead to destruction.

parts.statement: What is the meaning of 'perish'?
parts.explanation: 'Perish' means to die or be destroyed.

questions.text: Answer any six of the following questions in about 30 words:

parts.statement: What did Lencho hope for?
parts.explanation: Lencho hoped for rain, specifically a downpour or at least a shower, for his field of ripe corn to ensure a good harvest.

parts.statement: What did Nelson Mandela think about the oppressor and the oppressed?
parts.explanation: Mandela believed that both the oppressor (who is a prisoner of hatred) and the oppressed (who is deprived of dignity) are equally robbed of their humanity.

parts.statement: What made the woman in the control centre look at the narrator strangely?
parts.explanation: The woman looked strangely at the narrator because he asked her about the 'other' pilot (of the black aeroplane) after he himself had landed safely without any other plane being visible on the radar or in the sky.

parts.statement: Why does Anne want to keep a diary?
parts.explanation: Anne wants to keep a diary because she feels lonely and believes that paper has more patience than people. She lacked a true friend with whom she could share her deepest thoughts and feelings.

parts.statement: What qualities of the baker impressed the children?
parts.explanation: The children were impressed by the baker's 'jangle' of his special bamboo staff and the exciting smell of the loaves and bread-bangles he brought.

parts.statement: What does a 'jackfruit-like' appearance mean?
parts.explanation: It refers to a rough, bumpy, and ugly physical appearance, drawing a comparison to the bumpy, irregular surface of a jackfruit.

parts.statement: Why was Kisa Gotami sad? What did she do?
parts.explanation: Kisa Gotami was sad because her only son had died. She carried her dead child to all her neighbours and friends, begging for medicine to bring him back to life.

parts.statement: What compels the young seagull to finally fly?
parts.explanation: Extreme hunger compelled the young seagull to finally fly when he saw his mother tearing at a piece of fish just out of his reach. The sight of the food drove him mad, forcing him to take the plunge.

questions.text: Answer any two of the following questions in about 30 words:

parts.statement: What is the dominant mood of the poem 'Dust of Snow'?
parts.explanation: The dominant mood of the poem is one of subtle change and quiet joy. It shifts from despair or a low mood (the poet's initial state) to a lightened, uplifted mood due to a small, natural event.

parts.statement: How does the poet suggest that you identify the lion and the tiger?
parts.explanation: The poet suggests that a lion can be identified by its loud roar as it attacks, while a tiger can be identified by its black stripes on a yellow ground, and its tendency to attack silently at night.

parts.statement: Is Amanda an orphan? Why does she say so?
parts.explanation: Amanda is not a real orphan. She says so because she feels neglected and constantly harassed by her parents' nagging, which makes her wish for the freedom and solitude of an orphan's life.

questions.instruction: Answer any two of the following questions in about 30 words:

parts.statement: Why is Mrs. Pumphrey worried about Tricki?
parts.explanation: Mrs. Pumphrey is worried because her dog, Tricki, had become hugely fat, listless, and seemed to have no energy. She thought he was suffering from malnutrition and falling seriously ill.

parts.statement: Who was Fowler? Why did he want to meet Ausable?
parts.explanation: Fowler was a young writer who wanted to meet Ausable, a secret agent, because he was keen to experience the excitement and danger of a real-life secret agent's existence.

parts.statement: Why was the invisible man wandering the streets?
parts.explanation: The invisible man (Griffin) was wandering the streets because he had set fire to his landlord's house and had to remove his clothes to become invisible and escape. He had no clothes, shelter, or money.

questions.instruction: Answer any one of the following questions in about 75 words:

parts.statement: How did Mandela's hunger for freedom change his life?
parts.explanation: Mandela's hunger for freedom transformed him from a fearful young man into a bold one, compelled a law-abiding attorney to become a criminal, and changed a family-loving husband into a man without a home. It drove him to sacrifice his personal life for the struggle for the freedom of his people, changing him into a great political and spiritual leader.

parts.statement: Why does Lomov think he should get married?
parts.explanation: Lomov, being thirty-five, believes he is at a critical age where he must settle down. He thinks marriage will provide him with a settled, regular life and social security. He also feels he is suffering from various ailments like palpitations and a nervous temperament, and needs a companion to look after him.

questions.instruction: Answer any one of the following questions in about 75 words:

parts.statement: Write the central idea of the poem 'Fire and Ice'.
parts.explanation: The central idea of 'Fire and Ice' is that the world will end either through 'fire' (representing desire, greed, and lust) or 'ice' (representing hatred, coldness, and indifference). The poet concludes that both destructive emotions are equally capable and sufficient to bring about the end of the world.

parts.statement: What does the young man say to Anne Gregory?
parts.explanation: The young man in the poem tells Anne Gregory that no man could truly love her for herself alone, but only for her beautiful yellow hair. He implies that superficial beauty is what men are attracted to, not a woman's true, inner self. He suggests that only God can love a person purely for their soul, not their external appearance.

questions.instruction: Answer any one of the following questions in about 75 words:

parts.statement: What was the cause of Matilda's ruin? How could she have avoided it?
parts.explanation: Matilda's ruin was caused by her excessive pride, materialism, and vanity—her desire to appear wealthy by wearing borrowed jewellery. She could have avoided it by being honest: either by telling her friend, Madame Forestier, immediately that she had lost the necklace or by simply being content with what she had and not borrowing the item in the first place.

parts.statement: What was the real cause of Lomov and Natalya's argument?
parts.explanation: The real cause was not the ownership of the Oxen Meadows or the superiority of their dogs, but their own irritable, temperamental, and stubborn natures. Both were too proud and immature to concede a point, which led to their constant, petty arguments and the failure of a peaceful marriage proposal.
